## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[836, 278, 908, 294]]<|/det|>
9709/22  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 303, 312, 319]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Pure Mathematics 2  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[784, 303, 908, 319]]<|/det|>
May/June 2020  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 329, 908, 345]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 355, 395, 371]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 383, 390, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 418, 225, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 435, 880, 632]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 664, 216, 679]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 680, 732, 712]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 50.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
Given that \(2^{y} = 9^{3x}\), use logarithms to show that \(y = kx\) and find the value of \(k\) correct to 3 significant figures. [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 485, 92]]<|/det|>
The equation of a curve is \(\cos 3x + 5 \sin y = 3\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 106, 920, 125]]<|/det|>
Find the gradient of the curve at the point \(\left(\frac{1}{9}\pi , \frac{1}{6}\pi\right)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 106, 920, 125]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[312, 84, 722, 311]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 332, 920, 384]]<|/det|>
The variables \(x\) and \(y\) satisfy the equation \(y = A x^{- 2p}\), where \(A\) and \(p\) are constants. The graph of \(\ln y\) against \(\ln x\) is a straight line passing through the points \((- 0.68, 3.02)\) and \((1.07, - 1.53)\), as shown in the diagram.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 395, 336, 413]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(A\) and \(p\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 395, 920, 413]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 73, 722, 92]]<|/det|>
Sketch, on the same diagram, the graphs of \(y = |2x - 3|\) and \(y = 3x + 5\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 74, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 488, 149, 505]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 488, 462, 505]]<|/det|>
Solve the inequality \(3x + 5 < |2x - 3|\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 488, 920, 505]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 74, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 393, 92]]<|/det|>
The polynomial \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is defined by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 100, 603, 120]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{p}(x) = 6x^{3} + ax^{2} - 4x - 3,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 127, 621, 145]]<|/det|>
where \(a\) is a constant. It is given that \((x + 3)\) is a factor of \(\mathrm{p}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 159, 146, 176]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 159, 316, 176]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 159, 920, 176]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 432, 186, 450]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 432, 541, 450]]<|/det|>
Using this value of \(a\), factorise \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) completely.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 432, 920, 450]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 73, 433, 92]]<|/det|>
Show that \(3 \sin 2\theta \cot \theta \equiv 6 \cos^2 \theta\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 475, 186, 494]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 475, 556, 494]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(3 \sin 2\theta \cot \theta = 5\) for \(0 < \theta < \pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 475, 920, 494]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 82, 146, 101]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 72, 511, 112]]<|/det|>
Find the exact value of \(\int_{\frac{1}{4}\pi}^{\frac{1}{2}\pi} 3 \sin x \cot \frac{1}{2} x \, \mathrm{d}x.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 82, 920, 101]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[428, 74, 569, 92]]<|/det|>
